Author: Kiruel#2091
Content: No centralized information it's the purpose of the app. @Slyris

Author: Kiruel#2091
Content: Yeah I agree @jl777c .

Author: Kiruel#2091
Content: But we can track in the chain the swaps no ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think exporting per device is fine, if users need a 100% complete record, they just need to export from each phone. seems like not a big issue

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: when volumes are low, we can, but how to detect swaps that dont complete?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also for zaddr based swaps, the source and destination for half the swap is "invisible"

Author: Kiruel#2091
Content: Hum.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which means it will be more accurate to get the sum of local history than via blockchain

Author: Kiruel#2091
Content: I just think of people when they log with there seed to another platform like iOS to Android or in the future Desktop.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sum of all devices -> accurate history

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: without a centralized reporting i see no other way, especially when zaddr swaps come online

Author: Kiruel#2091
Content: Because they use centralized application everytime. That can be strange for users.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: unless you specifically export the zaddr swap info, there is no way anybody will be able to correlate

Author: Kiruel#2091
Content: Ok.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: welcome to the decentralized world

Author: Kiruel#2091
Content: haha

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: some things must be different

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: else it will be the same centralized world

Author: Kiruel#2091
Content: Yeah true but we need to teach ppl.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if people really need their history, they will find out how to export their history

Author: Kiruel#2091
Content: Or at-least find sollution to be close to centralized.

Author: Kiruel#2091
Content: (but still DEX)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: decentralized trading with centralized big brother tracking all swaps?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i feel allergic to this

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if people want to report, let them, but we cant force them. so that means we would need to record all trades from everybody to be able to record it centrally as we wont know if they will want a history in the future

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you see where this leads to?

Author: ca333#0118
Content: atomicDEX wouldnt be as efficient as it is if we did persist all swaps - what we can do in the future is turning it a local app feature with a local persisting DB for swaps. Not much more that can be done for now and until the swaps persist in the network which i see resulting in potential efficiency issues

Author: Kiruel#2091
Content: Yeah I see exalty.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and with zaddr swaps, it isnt possible to do it from blockchain, not to mention the difficulty in correlating who the other side of the swap was

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think a simple log of all swaps as they are complete would be sufficient and also handy for some of the requested features and bugs

Author: Kiruel#2091
Content: So it's just local first, and it's better like this. We just need to tell the users.

Author: Kiruel#2091
Content: Inside the app.

Author: ca333#0118
Content: yes exactly

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes exactly

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: Doesn't it conflict with statistics capturing that we have to implement? The swap statuses are sent and stored on seednodes now (which also helps to troubleshoot the swaps). How should we deal with this?

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: Anyone can be a seednode actually, but the data is still stored and can be tracked by `big brother` maintaining his own seednode.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: when the bugs are all fixed, then we can just get aggregate data from the blockchain

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: Do you mean by scanning the coins blockchains trying to find swap payments?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if we just need to get aggregate swap data, we can just track the amounts in the dexfee address and get a very good estimate

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: It might require some effort to collect such data and then try to detect what other coin participated in swap. What is the reason to do it if we can simply allow swap status broadcast to network?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for aggregate stats we dont need to correlate the other side

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: Of course we can add an option allowing user to disable this.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sum of all dexfees will get sum of all swaps

Author: miles#6381
Content:
Hi - just got the testflight invitation today and got started - pretty awesome, have done some rick > morty swaps and then some VRSC > KMD which have gone through in minutes over wireless.

Core swap functionality is amazing compared to where things were at with BarterDex MM1 - amazing effort, this is so cool!

I am on iOS iPhone 7 and found the usability tricky from the point of view of keeping the app in focus on the screen and not in the background. Using the app is fine, but waiting for swaps i ran into problems a few times

First few swaps timed out because the screen would lock, and when i bought the app back and accessed via touch ID it didn‚Äôt seem to like it much. (so set screen timeout to longer, which meant i got successful swaps but it set at 5 mins which obviously not ideal)

Assume swaps won‚Äôt complete whilst the app is in background mode?

Also seems that the touch ID biometric authentication can get it is in a bit of a mess when returning to the app double clicking to bring up the open apps in the background because the touch id message just keeps coming back even though it accepts my thumb and then app goes back into the background.

Other small thing i noticed when i first set up the wallet and hadn‚Äôt closed the app yet was when double clicking to get app into focus the screen that was being shown was the first screen with my seed in it! Now i have closed the app and started again and now the screen shown is the PIN screen as i would expect.

Using the actual app and swap function is so easy and simple, so cool, just need to test it on mobile now when walking to the pub for next use case :)

Thanks you everyone in the KMD that built this - its just phenomenal!!!

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: Current dexstats site contains both coins and their volumes.

Author: ca333#0118
Content: that gives user some sense of privacy and big brother can just parse the blockchains if he wants to track all swaps.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it seems it is just more work to add this and after debugging, and dexstats will just need to track activity at the dexfee address. it will need to do this to track DEX revshare anyway, so not any extra work

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if we are gathering this data, i just forsee it leading to bad things

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i prefer to optout everybody from this

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: ETH gas price is high now according to ethgasstation (https://ethgasstation.info/), the atomicDEX-API doesn't check gas price on order creation so it then results into failed swap as you attempt to trade amount close to your entire balance.

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: So the swap_status contains error from ETH RPC node: `\"Insufficient funds. The account you tried to send transaction from does not have enough funds. Required 13700000000000000 and got: 10745000000000000.\"`

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: I'd recommend to not trade ETH as of now at least until gas price gets lower.

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: The stuck VRSC payment should be refunded in few hours, please restart the app periodically.

Author: Simon#6247
Content: My original order of 25 seems back up, while balance stays at 15.21.

Author: FtrSaroth#2069
Content: Thanks  @artem.pikulin, with ltc tried two times 1 success and 1 failed, with eth tried 5 times and the 5 failed

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: You may try to trade lower amount but I wouldn't recommend this as fee will be quite high.

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: You are about to pay 1$ worth in ETH gas fee per trade.

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: At least 0,5$ each side.
